Package gg.w6.chesslib.model

Class Coordinate

java.lang.Object
gg.w6.chesslib.model.Coordinate
@Immutable public class Coordinate extends Object
Represents a coordinate on a chessboard.

Coordinates are represented in the format "a1", "h8", etc.

Example usage:


 Coordinate coordinate = Coordinate.valueOf("e4");

    • valueOf

      public static Coordinate valueOf(String coordinate)
      Creates a new Coordinate object from a string representation.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - The string representation of the coordinate (e.g., "e4").
      Returns:
      A Coordinate object representing the specified string.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the string is not a valid coordinate.

    • resetCache

      This method is used for testing purposes only.

    • is

      public boolean is(String coordinateString)
      Determine if this Coordinate corresponds to the coordinateString.

      For example, if Coordinate coordinate = Coordinate.valueOf(File.B, Rank.SEVEN);,

      then coordinate.is("b7"); is true.

      coordinateString is not case-sensitive.

      This is equivalent to

      this.equals(valueOf(coordinateString.toLowerCase()));

      Parameters:
      coordinateString - a String representing a coordinate
      Returns:
      true if equivalent
